title: Gaspare Spontini
subtitle: An 18th century Italian composer
description:
The following story will explore the WikiData knowledge base to discover the most significant points and events in the Italian composer Gaspare Spontini’s personal and professional life.  

After a general exploration of the WikiData knowledge base with the aim to discover the quantity of people and artists in comparison with MusicBO, we will then narrow down our research analyzing the composers recorded in WikiData, to eventually focus on our main object of the story: Gaspare Spontini.    

In particular, the story will present an overview of his biography, his occupations and fields of work, as well as the awards he received during his life, the academy where he worked and the cities where he lived.  

At the end of the story, there will be an insight into the Museum Gaspare Spontini, its location and the visitors he had per year.

dynamic_elements.chart_query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(?composer) AS ?count) 

WHERE { 

     ?composer wdt:P106 wd:Q36834;  # composer 

               wdt:P19 wd:Q38; #italian 

               wdt:P21 ?gender . # gender 

      

     SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". 

          ?gender rdfs:label  ?label. 

      }
 

} 

GROUP BY ?label 

ORDER BY DESC(?count)

Among the Italian composers there is Gaspare Spontini, perhaps less known than his main contemporary artist of the 18th century, but he is an artist of remarkable talent. We discovered this composer by digging in the Polifonia corpus and we were curious to know more about him.  

Here it is an example of context from MusicBO: 

“[...] a few of the chorus gathered in a semicircle around Spontini, in order to have a look at that remarkable man, as he held forth with wonderful effect on the requirements of true theatrical art.” 

Scroll down to discover more about this artist, admired and respected in all Europe and who’s worthy of attention. 



﻿

dynamic_elements.text:
After studying at the conservatory in Naples with Nicola Sala as teacher, he then started working at some comedies in Italy. However, he spent most of his career life in Paris, where he started working at the Opéra becoming one of the greatest Italian composers of his age, admired by Cherubini, Beethoven, Weber and Rossini. 

Because of the Bourbon Restoration, his works weren't considered as before, leading him to leave Paris for Berlin (at the time under the Kingdom of Prussia), where his operas had already achieved success, where he stayed until 1842.

Spontini was a member of the Académie des Beaux-Arts from June 15th 1839 when he replaced Ferdinando Paer, an Italian composer of German origins, to January 14th 1851 when he was then replaced by Ambroise Thomas, a French composer particularly famous for his work Mignon.

The Gaspare Spontini Museum is located in Maiolata Spontini, in the house where the composer and his wife spent the last years of their lives. Inside, we can find some music sheets, manuscripts, two pianos and some paintings depicting the staging of Spontini's French works, like The Miltondel, The Vestal and others.
